body:
> Normandy client looks at the most recent main ping, right? 

Yes.

> So does that mean that normandy.telemetry.creationDate is alwasys a fairly recent date? 

I can't say for sure, but I would guess no. I believe that date is set by the client, and client clocks are very untrustworth for absolute times (which is why the duration-based measure is probably the better one).

> And if yes, can we actually use that to infer the amount of time the user has been inactive for? I.e. the approximate time between the last time the user has used Firefox and their current session.

I don't think so, because when the client sends data to our servers probably isn't correlated with when their session started. They could be sending the ping at any time relative to when it was created.

If you want to know for sure, though, you should ask the Telemetry team.

Given that the existing measure is suitable for this campaign, I'm going to call this issue closed. We can reopen or re-file if, in the future, we want greater-than-per-day precision.

Normandy client looks at the most recent main ping, right?

I don't think so, because when the client sends data to our servers probably isn't correlated with when their session started. They could be sending the ping at any time relative to when it was created.
If you want to know for sure, though, you should ask the Telemetry team.
Given that the existing measure is suitable for this campaign, I'm going to call this issue closed. We can reopen or re-file if, in the future, we want greater-than-per-day precision.
